key_points_summary: Memorandum of appeal must be accompanied by a copy of the decree appealed against.
In second appeals, a copy of the judgment of the Court of first instance is required unless dispensed by the Appellate Court.
Provisions allow for a single copy of the judgment when multiple cases are tried together.
Appellate Courts should specify 'plaintiff' or 'defendant' in appeals involving different parties.
Decrees of the Appellate Court must contain specific contents as per Order XLI, Rule 35.
Appeals in forma pauperis require the Court to find the decree contrary to law before admission.
defence_preparation_checklist: Verify compliance with Order XLI, Rule 1 regarding accompanying documents.
Ensure that the judgment of the Court of first instance is included in second appeals.
Check for proper identification of parties in the appeal.
Review the contents of the decree as per Order XLI, Rule 35.
Assess the grounds for any appeals in forma pauperis.

identified_issues_or_defects: Potential non-compliance with requirements for second appeals.
Possibility of improper identification of parties in appeals.

proper discretion in view of all the circumstances. But
Courts should endeavour to dispose of cases on merits
as far as practicable and avoid dismissals in default
when this can be done without wasting of time of the
Court or prejudice to other litigants.
